meanings.definition: A large nocturnal bird with a loud, harsh call.
meanings.sent1: The bullbats flew silently in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: I heard the eerie call of the bullbats while camping.
meanings.sent3: The bullbats decided to have a singing competition at midnight.
meanings.sent4: The bullbats' cries pierced through the darkness like sharp arrows.
meanings.sent5: The bullbats' haunting screeches echoed through the forest.

meanings.sent1: The magician used sleight of hand to bullbats the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her clever words managed to bullbats even the most skeptical minds.
meanings.sent3: Trying to bullbats a detective is like trying to outsmart a fox.
meanings.sent4: The intricate plot twist in the movie completely bullbats the viewers.
meanings.sent5: The misleading signs were meant to bullbats unwary travelers.

meanings.definition: A person who talks nonsense or boasts.
meanings.sent1: Don't listen to him, he's just a silly bullbats.
meanings.sent2: The old man at the park turned out to be a harmless bullbats.
meanings.sent3: The bullbats at the party claimed he could juggle elephants!
meanings.sent4: She dismissed him as a mere bullbats with no substance.
meanings.sent5: The village was entertained by the antics of the local bullbats.
